comment.author: 42264328@N00
comment._content: An Internet search brings up this NY Times article from 5 November 1912, describing, apparently, a battle at Sakizkey, but seems to refer to "Battle of Lule-Burgas" (Wikipedia), cOctober-November 1912, between Bulgarians and Ottoman Turks. Perhaps.

comment.author: 42264328@N00
comment._content: Aha! Excellent research swanq. A Google search of "Battle Sakizkoy" turns up a NY Times article from 5 November 1912 referring to the Battle of Lule Burgas circa 30 October 1912, near Sakizkoy--mentioned in the NY Times article. The date of the NY Times article agrees with the dates of the battle given in the Wikipedia article linked. (This is a different NY Times article than the one linked in my comment above, but by the same correspondent, Ellis Ashmead-Bartlett--Wikipedia article.) Bartlett mentions a "young English photographer named Gordon", I wonder if he could have been the one to take this photo? Of course it seems that war was well-covered, I also see that the American photojournalist Jimmy Hare covered it. Seems like the place and date of this photo are relatively well-established, between 30 October and 3 November 1912, near Sakizkoy, Turkey. A sad tale of misery--the Balkan Wars--rather overshadowed in history by the infinitely more horrible World War I to come in just two years.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks.  We'll add this identification and date to the source data and reload the description.
